sense.name: make or position so as to be square
sense.commentary: Includes: SQUARE UP NOTE: Includes metaphorical uses like sentence 2.
sense.examples: After showing the 5 of spades he squared the deck. I squared my shoulders and walked into the clinic. He squared the sides with red squares and chopped them up into pieces. Bobby put his eye back to the viewfinder and squared up the shot. After we cut some tubing and squared up the edges, we started to weld.

sense.name: cause to match (ideas or acts); be compatible
sense.examples: He squared the match with a birdie at No. 13. It's amazing! All your beliefs square with mine!

sense.name: put things in order; settle conclusively
sense.commentary: Includes: SQUARE AWAY, SQUARE OFF, SQUARE UP
sense.examples: The waitress has finally squared up her debts with the government. Ten minutes later I had squared away my free reservation into Midway airport. The client had squared off his transactions in most of the settlements. 'Mom, you need to get the house squared away, we have important guests coming!' The two teams are squaring off to see which one will be #1 in the nation.

sense.name: turn an oar or paddle while rowing or canoeing
sense.examples: Jim and I squared away to paddle upstream.

sense.name: SQUARE DANCE: dance the square-dance
sense.examples: Molly would square dance until her legs were numb.

sense.name: SQUARE THE CIRCLE: do the impossible
sense.commentary: Is: SQUARE THE CIRCLE NOTE: Literally the definition is: 'to determine the exact contents of a circle in square measure. Which is posited as impossible.' NOTE: Usually used in the negative construction.
sense.examples: You cannot square the circle on this issue. Mother Theresa nearly squared the circle on world hunger!
